article.title: Young LMC clusters: the role of red supergiants and multiple stellar populations in their integrated light and CMDs

multiple_choice_question.text: **Figure 1** shows two partial SSPs (pSSPs) with LMC metallicity and an age of 10 Myr. What is the significance of the difference in slope between the two pSSPs?
choices: The pSSP dominated by stars with M > 17 M<sub>☉</sub> is redder due to a higher contribution from red supergiants (RSGs).
The pSSP dominated by stars with M < 17 M<sub>☉</sub> is bluer due to a higher contribution from main sequence stars.
The difference in slope reflects the different evolutionary stages of stars within the two mass ranges.

multiple_choice_question.text: **Figure 4** examines the TiO1 and HdA line indices in the context of the cluster ages. What key discrepancy does this figure highlight?
choices: The HdA index indicates significantly older ages for the clusters compared to the TiO1 index.
The observed TiO1 indices for the clusters are much stronger than predicted by LMC metallicity models, suggesting an underestimation of the RSG contribution.
The models accurately reproduce the observed HdA values, supporting the reliability of age estimates based on this index.
The line-strength analysis confirms that the cluster ages are well-constrained and consistent with single SSP models.

multiple_choice_question.text: **Figure 7** compares the spectral fitting results for NGC 1984 and NGC 2011 using different methods. What is the main conclusion drawn from this comparison?
choices: Using two SSPs with LMC metallicity significantly improves the fit compared to a single SSP, suggesting the presence of multiple stellar populations.
Shifting to solar metallicity, even though these clusters have LMC metallicities, provides a better fit due to the higher ratio of red to blue supergiants predicted for higher metallicities.
Varying the RSG contribution by adding the spectrum of a representative RSG star results in the best fit, regardless of the metallicity of the SSP.
Both B and C are correct

multiple_choice_question.text: **Equation 3** describes a method to test the impact of substituting the evolutionary prescription for LMC metallicity with that of solar metallicity for more evolved stars. What is the rationale behind this approach?
choices: To investigate if the modeling of massive stars for LMC metallicity is inaccurate and could be improved by using the prescription for solar metallicity.
To confirm that the metallicity of the SSP used in the fitting has a negligible impact on the results.
To account for the possibility that the clusters may contain a mix of stars with both LMC and solar metallicity.
This approach has no physical basis and is merely a mathematical exercise to improve the fit.
